text: Palicus is a genus of stilt crabs in the family Palicidae. ==Species== Twenty- two species are included in the genus : *Palicus acutifrons (A. Milne-Edwards, 1880) *Palicus affinis (A. Milne-Edwards & Bouvier, 1880) *Palicus alternatus Rathbun, 1897 *Palicus angustus Rathbun, 1897 *Palicus bahamensis Rathbun, 1897 *Palicus caronii (Roux, 1828) *Palicus cristatipes (A. Milne-Edwards, 1880) *Palicus cortezi (Crane, 1937) *Palicus cursor (A. Milne-Edwards, 1880) *Palicus dentatus (A. Milne-Edwards, 1880) *Palicus depressus Rathbun, 1897 *Palicus faxoni Rathbun, 1897 *Palicus fragilis (Rathbun, 1894) *Palicus gracilipes (A. Milne-Edwards, 1880) *Palicus gracilis (Smith, 1883) *Palicus isthmia Rathbun, 1897 *Palicus lucasii Rathbun, 1898 *Palicus obesus (A. Milne-Edwards, 1880) *Palicus sicus (A. Milne-Edwards, 1880) *Palicus tuberculata (Faxon, 1893) *Palicus velerae (Garth, 1939) *Palicus zonatus (Rathbun, 1894) ==References== Category:Crabs
title: Palicus
